Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE)

Source: R/plot_risk_vs_ve.R
plot_risk_vs_ve.Rd

For a given basic reproduction number (R0) and vaccine coverage, this function plots the outbreak probability against vaccine effectiveness (VE) using the ob_summary grid. Both traveller and worker pathways are shown for comparison.

Usage

plot_risk_vs_ve(data = quarrisk::ob_summary, r0, coverage, show_points = FALSE)

Arguments

data

Tibble with columns r0, ve, coverage, traveller_ob_prob, worker_ob_prob. Defaults to quarrisk::ob_summary.

r0

Numeric, target basic reproduction number.

coverage

Numeric in [0, 1], target vaccine coverage.

show_points

Logical; if TRUE, also draw points on the lines.

Value

A ggplot2 object showing outbreak probability vs VE for the specified r0 and coverage.

Details

The function filters the scenario grid to rows with the requested r0 and coverage (exact matches on the grid), then plots both traveller and worker outbreak probabilities as a function of VE.

See also

slice_scenario, ob_summary

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Basic usage
  plot_risk_vs_ve(r0 = 2, coverage = 0.8)

  # With points
  plot_risk_vs_ve(r0 = 3, coverage = 0.6, show_points = TRUE)
} # }
